Module com.example.miniproject2
Package com.example.miniproject2.model

Interface IBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
ABoard, Board
public interface IBoard
The IBoard interface defines the contract for Sudoku board implementations. It outlines the essential methods that any board class must implement to manage the state of a Sudoku game.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    fillMatrix(int i)
    Fills the specified row of the board with valid numbers according to Sudoku rules.
    ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>>
    getRandomMatrix()
    Retrieves the randomly generated matrix for the board.
    boolean
    isAnyNumPosible(int i, int j)
    Checks if any valid number can be placed in the specified cell.

  • Method Details

    • fillMatrix

      void fillMatrix(int i)
      Fills the specified row of the board with valid numbers according to Sudoku rules.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the row to fill.

    • isAnyNumPosible

      boolean isAnyNumPosible(int i, int j)
      Checks if any valid number can be placed in the specified cell.
      Parameters:
      i - The row index of the cell.
      j - The column index of the cell.
      Returns:
      true if at least one number can be placed, false otherwise.

    • getRandomMatrix

      ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> getRandomMatrix()
      Retrieves the randomly generated matrix for the board.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList representing the random matrix of the board.
